search_results.title: True North
search_results.lyrics:
True North Lyrics[Verse 1]
Sometimes I think you forget
All the places you have been
All the miles that you have spent
Spinning your wheels around
There inside your head
A list of things you haven't done yet
Oh, but my friend, I would bet
You’re gonna knock 'em out

[Chorus]
'Cause honey, you found your true north
There ain’t no gold that's worth more
You figured out what you're fighting for
Honey, you found your true north
[Verse 2]
Sometimes it's hard to see
Oh, but it's so clear to me
'Cause there's a light that shines brightly
In everything you do
But you nevеr get to know
And that's a beauty I suppose
So, I’ll bе there to tell you so
That I believe in you

[Chorus]
’Cause honey you found your true north
There ain't no gold that’s worth more
You figured out what you're fighting for
Honey, you found your true north
Honey, you found your true north
There ain't no gold that's worth more
You figured out what you’re fighting for
Honey, you found your true northYou might also likeEmbed

search_results.title_with_featured: Carolina Spence - I Know You Know Me (With Matt Berninger) [Türkçe Çeviri]
search_results.lyrics:
Carolina Spence - I Know You Know Me (With Matt Berninger) [Türkçe Çeviri] Lyrics[Dize 1: Carolina Spence]
Dışarı çıkıp yalnız başıma yürümeyi denediğim zamanlar
Bir eli tutmaya ihtiyacım yokmuş gibi davranıyorum
Saklanıyorum, ama senin bunu görebildiğinin farkındayım
Beni tanıdığının farkındayım

[Dize 2: Matt Berninger]
Kumun üstüne bi şeyler karaladığım zamanlar
Sen o gelgiti geri çeken ay oluveriyorsun
Yükseliyor ve düşüyorum, yerçekimini seziyorum
Beni tanıdığının farkındayım
[Chorus: Carolina Spence& Matt Berninger]
Beni tanıdığının farkındayım, tanığının farkındayım
Beni tanıdığının farkındayım, tanığının farkındayım
Beni tanıdığının farkındayım

[Dize 3: Carolina Spence& Matt Berninger]
Aklımın neresinde fırtınalar koptuğunun bi önemi yok
Bulamayacağın bi yer hiç olamyacak
Mumu yakıyor, ah, anahtarları tutuyorsun
Beni tanıdığının farkındayım

[Chorus:Carolina Spence& Matt Berninger]
Beni tanıdığının farkındayım, tanığının farkındayım
Beni tanıdığının farkındayım, tanığının farkındayım
Beni tanıdığının farkındayımYou might also likeEmbed

search_results.full_title: Heart of Somebody by Caroline Spence
search_results.title: Heart of Somebody
search_results.lyrics:
Heart of Somebody Lyrics[Verse 1]
I've been going out, I’ve been making plans
Trying to pretend this is who I am
But I need something more, I want something else
This is the well and I want the top shelf

[Chorus]
I wanna lose myself in the heart of somebody
Want them to need me there, not just to want me
I wanna lose myself in the heart of somebody
And see the love I give return to me
[Verse 2]
Empty glasses and empty promises
Filling up my nights but in the morning I just wanna forget
I want to be full and bursting at the seams
With love, unconditionally

[Chorus]
I wanna lose myself in the heart of somebody
Want them to need me there, not just to want me
I wanna lose myself in the heart of somebody
See the love I give return to me
Just want the love I give to return to meYou might also likeEmbed

description.plain:
WELCOME TO GENIUS' MAY 2019 ALBUM RELEASE CALENDAR!!!



For May 2019 singles releases, visit this page



This page highlights the notable albums, EPs, mixtapes, etc, released in all genres throughout May 2019. Each corresponding annotation lists a tracklist, complete with links to the lyrics, hosted here on Genius. The number to the right of the title serves as a counter of how many songs are up on Genius.

HOW CAN YOU HELP?


Adding projects



If there’s a notable project you think should be listed here, add it! Or add a comment at the bottom of the page if you’re not sure. No self-promotion, please.


Adding lyrics



If you transcribed a song, comment on the album’s annotation and it will be linked into the tracklist


Updating dates



If we have any dates wrong, etc, add a comment at the bottom of the page.

body.plain:
WELCOME TO GENIUS' MAY 2019 ALBUM RELEASE CALENDAR!!!



For May 2019 singles releases, visit this page



This page highlights the notable albums, EPs, mixtapes, etc, released in all genres throughout May 2019. Each corresponding annotation lists a tracklist, complete with links to the lyrics, hosted here on Genius. The number to the right of the title serves as a counter of how many songs are up on Genius.

HOW CAN YOU HELP?


Adding projects



If there’s a notable project you think should be listed here, add it! Or add a comment at the bottom of the page if you’re not sure. No self-promotion, please.


Adding lyrics



If you transcribed a song, comment on the album’s annotation and it will be linked into the tracklist


Updating dates



If we have any dates wrong, etc, add a comment at the bottom of the page.

search_results.full_title: Sit Here and Love Me by Caroline Spence
search_results.title: Sit Here and Love Me
search_results.lyrics:
Sit Here and Love Me Lyrics[Verse 1]
Like the moon in the sky
In the afternoon in July
A little darkness hangs there above me
I know you hate to see me cry
Don't wanna look you in the eye
I just need you to sit here and love me

[Chorus]
I'm alright, my dear
I've been this way as long as I've been here
I don't need you to solve any problem at all
I just need you to sit here and love me
[Verse 2]
At the bottom of this well
Sometimes it's hard to tell
If you're up there or if you can see me
I'm still someone you know
Please recognize my shadow
This is the same place from where I love you deeply

[Chorus]
I'm alright, my dear
I've been this way as long as I've been here
I don't need you to solve any problem at all
I just need you to sit here and love me

I'm alright, my dear
I've been this way as long as I've been here
I don't need you to solve any problem at all
I just need you to sit here and love me

[Outro]
I don't need you to solve any problem at all
I just need you to sit here and love meYou might also likeEmbed

description.plain:
Spence explained in an interview:

I’m dating someone with an incredibly sunny disposition, and as a person who deals with depression and anxiety, I’ve had to explain all that to him while knowing he might never fully understand it. That song is my way of saying, ‘Don’t worry, it’s okay – you don’t have to try and fix anything for me. Just be exactly how you are.'

description.plain:
This is a list of songs performed by the Glee Cast during season 1. There are six seasons total.

Each annotation includes a link to the song, who the song is originally by, and who performs it in the show. Note that some songs are performed multiple times; however, only one annotation should exist per song, so please leave a comment if there’s a duplicate!

body.plain:
This is a list of songs performed by the Glee Cast during season 1. There are six seasons total.

Each annotation includes a link to the song, who the song is originally by, and who performs it in the show. Note that some songs are performed multiple times; however, only one annotation should exist per song, so please leave a comment if there’s a duplicate!

annotations: “This Is How We Do It”

“This Is How We Do It” is a song by Montell Jordan on his 2005 album This Is How We Do It.

The song is performed in Episode 3, “Acafellas”, by the Acafellas.

It’s not included on any official release.
“Poison”

“Poison” is a song by Bell Biv DeVoe on their 1990 album Poison.

The song is performed in Episode 3, “Acafellas”, by the Acafellas.

It’s not included on any official release.
“All by Myself”

“All by Myself” is a song by Eric Carmen on his 1975 album Eric Carman.

The song is performed in Episode 2, “Showmance”, by Emma Pillsbury.

It’s not included on any official release.
“Push It”

“Push It” is a song by Salt-N-Pepa on their 1988 album A Salt with a Deadly Pepa.

The song is performed in Episode 2, “Showmance”, by New Directions.

It’s included in Glee: The Music, The Complete Season One.
“Jump”

“Jump” is a song by Van Halen on their 1984 album 1984.

The song is performed in Episode 12, “Mattress”, by New Directions.

It’s included in Glee: The Music, The Complete Season One.
“Somewhere Over the Rainbow”

“Somewhere Over the Rainbow” is a song from the musical The Wizard of Oz.

The song is performed in Episode 22, “Journey”, by Will Schuester with Noah Puckerman.

It’s included in Glee: The Music, The Complete Season One.
“To Sir, with Love”

“To Sir, with Love” is a song by Lulu on the soundtrack of the 1967 film To Sir, with Love.

The song is performed in Episode 22, “Journey”, by New Directions.

It’s included in Glee: The Music, The Complete Season One.
“Faithfully”

“Faithfully” is a song by Journey on their 1983 album Frontiers.

The song is performed in Episode 22, “Journey”, by Rachel Berry and Finn Hudson.

It’s included in Glee: The Music, The Complete Season One.
“Give Up the Funk”

“Give Up the Funk” is a song by Parliament on their 1975 album Mothership Connection.

The song is performed in Episode 21, “Funk”, by New Directions.

It’s included in Glee: The Music, The Complete Season One.
“Good Vibrations”

“Good Vibrations” is a song by Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch on their 1991 album Music for the People.

The song is performed in Episode 21, “Funk”, by Finn Hudson, Noah Puckerman and Mercedes Jones.

It’s included in Glee: The Music, The Complete Season One.

search_results.title: Hotel Amarillo
search_results.lyrics:
Hotel Amarillo LyricsI'm just passing through, it'll only be the night
I just need somewhere to crash where I can turn off all the lights
I put five hundred miles on my sweet old ride
Now I'm pulling into Hotel Amarillo with a bottle of wine

I've been playing shows out west with no guarantee
That anybody's ever gonna give a damn about me
I made enough last night to fill the tank up one more time
And to pull on into Hotel Amarillo with a bottle of wine

I've got no one to sleep on the other half of this king-size bed
But that lady still gave me two keys when I checked in
I wish that didn't make me think about how you've been spending your time
Glad I pulled on into Hotel Amarillo with a bottle of wine
Out here it's the little things that you start to miss
That long hot shower, that slow deep kiss
Yeah things like where you are and the date and time
Or the name of the hotel and what happened to the wineYou might also likeEmbed

song.title: Hotel Amarillo

search_results.title: Mint Condition
search_results.lyrics:
Mint Condition Lyrics[Verse 1: Caroline Spence]
My favorite things are tired and worn
A dog-eared book with the cover torn
But when I see you it's like the very first day
There are some things you don't want to fade

[Chorus: Caroline Spence]
Still in mint condition, mint condition
Like when we were two kids just hopin' and wishin'
This life that we see ain't no apparition
So we keep our love in mint condition
[Verse 2: Caroline Spence]
You can hide love away in a trunk or a box
You can throw out the keys once you lock all the locks
But some things, they last, and some things, they won't
Oh, but nothing 'bout you ever gets old

[Chorus: Caroline Spence and Emmylou Harris]
Still in mint condition, mint condition
Like when we were two kids just hopin' and wishin'
This life that we see ain't no apparition
So we keep our love in mint condition

[Verse 3: Caroline Spence and Emmylou Harris]
Our bodies, they age, wrinkle, and tire
That feeling of comfort overtakes desire
I might have to learn to live here alone
But I'll love you through ash or through stone

[Chorus: Caroline Spence and Emmylou Harris]
Still in mint condition, mint condition
Like when we were two kids just hopin' and wishin'
This life that we see ain't no apparition
So we keep our love in mint condition

[Outro: Caroline Spence and Emmylou Harris]
'Cause we're still just two kids hopin' and wishin'
We keep our love in mint conditionYou might also likeEmbed
